Package slotmachine.model

Interface Player

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PlayerImpl
    public interface Player
    Represents a player in the Slot Machine in Further Programming Assignment

    Is to be implemented as PlayerImpl.

    Each player has an id and a name, both of which cannot be changed once assigned. The player has a credits balance which is used in placing bets within the game.

    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    SlotMachine, SlotMachine.registerPlayer(String, String, int)

      • getCredits

        int getCredits()
        Simple getter for player's current credits
        Returns:
        the player's current credits

      • getAvailableCredits

        int getAvailableCredits()
        Returns the available total credits for a player, which excludes any amount currently bet.

        Hint: If the player doesn't have a current bet this method should return the current credit, otherwise the amount returned should exclude the bet amount.

        Returns:
        the player's current available credits.

      • addCredits

        void addCredits​(int credits)
        A mutator method to add to the current credits
        Parameters:
        credits - credits to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if credits are not positive number

      • getBet

        int getBet()
        Simple getter method for the current amount bet by the player.

        Hint:This amount should total all amounts for each SlotLine which are maintained in the SlotMachine.

        Returns:
        the current amount that is bet by the player

      • setBet

        void setBet​(int bet)
        Simple setter method for the current amount bet by the player.

        Hint:This amount should total all amounts for each SlotLine which are maintained in the SlotMachine. The amount passed in as a parameter should just be the current total bets for all lines.

        Parameters:
        bet - the amount bet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bet is not positive number

      • resetBet

        void resetBet()
        Resets the amount currently bet by the player to zero

      • applyWin

        void applyWin​(int winAmount)
        A mutator method that applies the result of all the wins from a single spin of the SlotMachine.

        If the winAmount is greater than 0 then the player wins the winAmount and their credits should be adjusted. Otherwise the player has lost the amount currently bet.

        Note: Bets should not be automatically reset here.

        Parameters:
        winAmount - the amount won from the spin

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representing the Player in format shown in the examples below and seen in the output trace. 
         Player ABC, Me, credits 30, bet 0, available 30
 
         Player ABC, Me, credits 150, bet 60, available 90
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing the Player
